data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'measureLineHeightAndDefaultCharWidth' of undefined
data.body:

**Atom Version**: 0.182.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.2

data.title: Do not open an "untitled" editor at startup
data.body:
Atom should not open an "untitled" editor at startup.

It should either start with no open editors, or else start with the last open editor (especially where the last open editor was a folder).

Otherwise, if it starts with an "untitled" editor, one needs to first press CMD+Shift+W and then CMD+O to get where one wants.

data.title: renaming file doesn't always update tab title
data.body:
The file's tab doesn't update if the change to the file name was only letter case, ie foo.coffee -> Foo.coffee.

I can't imagine this actually hurting anything but it's something I noticed.

data.title: Fix a bug when a URI is passed to atom.project.removePath().
command palette
Optional API for DirectoryProvider: excludeFromSerialization(Directory).
JavaScript syntax highlight is broken
Handle invalid CSS selectors in menus and commands
data.body:
Calling `webkitMatchesSelector(selector)` on an element will throw an error. There were several places in core where these errors weren't being caught and handled.
- [x] Throw an error when `atom.commands.add` is called with an invalid selector
- [x] Throw an error when `atom.contextMenu.add` is called with an invalid selector
- [x] Show a notification when a package has invalid selectors in their activation commands
- [x] Show a notification when a package has invalid selectors in their context menu
- [x] Show a notification when a package has an invalid grammar
- [x] Show a notification when a package has invalid settings
- [x] Show a notification on all caught package load/activate errors

Closes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5098
Closes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5536
Closes #5743
Closes https://github.com/atom/command-palette/issues/30
Closes https://github.com/atom/command-palette/issues/32

The new notifications look like this when a package fails to load or activate:

![screen shot 2015-03-03 at 6 13 01 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/671378/6476914/ff64b8ec-c1d0-11e4-9df4-55a64ae4b50d.png)

data.title: Code zooming doesn't work if shortcut is pressed with very short gap
data.body:
Not a very harmful bug, though worth mentioning:
Behavior: shortcut `cmd` + `+` /  `-` if pressed in very small timegap, it doesn't perform expected behavior. Text size remains same in such situation.

Expected behavior: whatever interval the gap be, the font size should decrease / increase corresponding to the key press.

Steps to reproduce: press `cmd` + `+` successively very fast
Tested on: OS X 10.10, atom `v0.184.0`

data.title: typing `atom .` opens the directory twice in the file explorer pane
data.body:
When I type `atom .` from the terminal the directory is seen twice in the file explorer on the left.

This only started happening recently and I am not sure what caused it.

Platform: windows
Version: 0.182.0

How can I help debug this further?

Thank you.

data.title: Move the logic for opening empty initial buffer to the renderer process
data.body:
Using this solution to atom/welcome#26 instead of #5812

Closes atom/welcome#26

data.title: Quitting with an unsaved document doesn't allow you to refer back to the document
data.body: On OS X, if you quit Atom and have an unsaved untitled document, it will prompt you to save it. The 'Cancel' option does not stop the Quit, it just quits the application without letting you refer back to the document. There is no way to go back and look at the unsaved document so that you can save it appropriately. This forces me to save 'unknown.txt' to my desktop whenever this happens and then go and open the file, look at its contents, and then decide whether to keep it, rename it, or move it somewhere else.

data.title: Typo - Welcome guide -  Customize the styling - button
data.body:
**Version:** Atom 0.184.0
**On:** Linux Ubuntu 14.10 64-bit
**Description:** There is a typo on the button label in the welcome guide.

Reproduce: 
1. Open the welcome guide
2. Expand 'Customize the Styling'
3. Use your eyeballs to examine the button label

_'Open your Styleshet'_ **should be** _'Open your Stylesheet'_

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6444186/6468274/3f1e1874-c191-11e4-897a-a35b811cd6a4.png)

data.title: pressing tab inserts spaces even though the settings are set to use tabs and no space is present before a line of code
data.body:
This can be fixed by closing and opening the file after you remove all the tabspaces and replace them with tabs
Maybe the detect of use tabs/spaces mechanism can be run continuously.

data.title: Close startup untitled buffer on opening another file
data.body:
When Atom is opened, an "untitled" buffer is created. This makes sense.

However, most of the time, after opening Atom, I then proceed to opening the files I want to edit. At this point, the "untitled" tab remains open even if I haven't changed anything in it.

This is slightly annoying, because it means I have to close a tab that I never wanted in the beginning.

data.title: Incorrect highlighting of corresponding start and end tags
data.body:
The following programming style is often used in systems like Wordpress:
![screen shot 2015-03-03 at 14 44 09](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3964073/6463587/d2c45a4e-c1b3-11e4-8a14-877aed3f0191.png)
The opening php tag is directly after the HTML element name without a space. As you can see in the screenshot, this seams to confuse the highlighting mechanism. As a result the correct corresponding start tag of the last div is not highlighted:
![screen shot 2015-03-03 at 14 44 55](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3964073/6463592/e7e379fa-c1b3-11e4-83c2-0bc1399b1e54.png)

data.title: Additional fold behaviors when pressing modifier keys
data.body:
It would be great if we could get some additional behaviors for folds while the user is pressing modifier keys like in [ACE](https://github.com/ajaxorg/ace/).

I use these pretty extensively while working with complex JS files or lengthy JSON streams and I'd like to see them in Atom someday.

The main ones that I use in ACE are:
- fold children (`shift-click` fold decoration)
- fold children recursively (`shift-cmd-click` fold decoration)
- fold recursively (`cmd-click` fold decoration)

data.title: Select range for paired brackets on double click
data.body:
It would be great if double-clicking a paired token (bracket, brace, paren, quote, back-ticks, slash, etc.) selected to the other associated token, inclusively.

Here are a couple of examples of things that do this that I use frequently:
- `Terminal.app` in Mac OS X
- [ACE](https://github.com/ajaxorg/ace/) editor

data.title: Large Files Cause Hangups
data.body:
Hi,

Been using atom for a while now, love it and totally swapped full time from sublime, great work guys!

I have been having a few issues with large files.... I have to edit large files some times, a PHP file that has approx 5395 lines and another JS file with approx 9672 lines.... ;) 

I currently have a custom theme in use (my own razor-atom-syntax-theme) and have a lot of other packages installed... linters, save-session, file-icons, highlight-selected, lesscompile, color-picker, minimap, open-recent.....

I seem to be getting really sluggish performance on these files, with the UI refresh update taking a good second or two on every key press.... The laptop is more than capable, new, plenty of ram, SSD so it is defo not the laptop as sublime is fine.

I just wondered what large file size support is like in Atom? What sizes should we be good for?

turning the linters off most certainly helps but still has a slight lag, any thoughts?

thanks

Paul

data.title: Multiple Atom instances
data.body:
I want to work on different repositories at the same time. I heard that the tree-view is displayed only for the active folder, which indeed seems to be the case. 

Given that behaviour, I can't browse outside the repository from which I launched atom in that atom instance. Instead, I tried to launch a new instance from another repo. This, however, simply adds that file to the already open instance, but does not give me tree-view for the second repo.

So, how can I:
- launch two parallel instances of atom
  OR
- switch the tree-view along with the file I am editing within one instance.

If both are possible, which one would you recommend?

data.title: Select buffer lines when clicking the gutter, not screen lines
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5738:
-  d21ae2c modifies the click handlers for the gutter to select buffer lines, rather than screen lines. Clicking the gutter for any screen line of a wrapped buffer line selects the whole buffer line (previously, only the clicked screen line would have been selected).
- 03a064b adds more tests for checking how click handlers for the gutter behave when soft wrap is turned on (I duplicated all the existing tests, turned on soft wrap, and then tweaked them to test the new functionality).

Before :tv: (notice screen lines being selected):

![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/38924/6350264/964de4e4-bc32-11e4-8e79-e7f61220a2c5.gif)

After :tv: (notice buffer lines being selected):

![gutter](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/38924/6463027/d748e13e-c1ae-11e4-9002-f0ee33a264b2.gif)

cc @nathansobo for :eyes:

data.title: Make it possible to restore a root folder created by a DirectoryProvider.
data.body:
Previously, the challenge in restoring a root folder created by a `DirectoryProvider`
was that the `DirectoryProvider` that created the root folder during the previous
session may not be available when the `Project` is restored via deserialization.

This adds a new method to the `DirectoryProvider` API named `getHostPackage()`
(it also bumps the version of `atom.directory-provider` from 0.1.0 to 0.2.0).
A `DirectoryProvider` must return the name of the Atom package that provided it
or `null`. (Surprisingly, it is not possible to get this information programmatically
today, though ServiceHub could potentially be expanded to provide this. However,
it would only work for providers statically declared in `package.json`, but not for
those that are registered dynamically, so it might not be worth it.)

When a `Directory` is created via a `DirectoryProvider`, the correspoding Atom
package via `DirectoryProvider::getHostPackage()` is recorded as part of the `Project`
so it can be serialized along with the `Project`'s paths.

This way, when `Project` is deserialized, paths that have a corresponding "host package"
can be filtered from ones that do not. Paths without a corresponding host package will
be loaded normally. Those with a host package will have their package activated so
the `DirectoryProvider` can be restored, which will hopefully be able to recreate the
root folder from the previous session.

When a new `DirectoryProvider` is registered, the `Project` checks to see whether
there were any paths from the previous session that correspond to its host package.
If so, each path is fed to the provider's async `directoryForURI` method. Assuming it
returns a `Promise` that returns a non-null value, the path will be added to the
`Project` via `atom.project.addPath()`. This allows the provider to do any async I/O
or network communication it needs to do to recreate the `Directory` (which it should
cache) before its synchronous `directoryForURISync()` method is invoked as a side-effect
of `atom.project.addPath()`. Assuming the provider caches the path->`Directory` mapping
during the async invocation, it can return it immediately as part of the sync invocation.

data.title: Add Workspace::onWillOpen
data.body:
This will add an `Workspace::onWillOpen` event to allow fixing https://github.com/atom/welcome/issues/26. Usage would look something like this

``` coffee
# Suppress the opening of the initial empty buffer
atom.workspace.onWillOpen ({uri, options, cancel}) ->
  cancel() if options.isInitialEmptyBuffer
```

Refs https://github.com/atom/welcome/issues/26

How do you guys feel about this approach?

data.title: Add method for packages to extend command-line interface
data.body:
I see a lot of issues and suggestions around people wanting new command-line options. It would be great if people could write their own command-line option handler. Perhaps something like this:
- keymaps
- lib
- options
  - standalone.coffee
- spec
- styles

`standalone.coffee` contains:

``` coffee
module.exports = (arg) ->
  # Do something with the argument here
```

See: 
- https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/1433#issuecomment-76732628
- https://discuss.atom.io/t/add-z-command-line-option-to-ignore-next-parameter/13879

data.title: atom need to add a command
data.body: both treeveiw'popmenu and menu-file need to add "create(new) root folder"
